alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 1:43PM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches across the Jackson County Foothills and Umpqua Divide. Snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches across the Kalmiopsis mountains. * WHERE...Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County above 2500 ft elevation. This includes the foothills of Jackson County, the Umpqua Divide and the Kalmiopsis mountains of Curry and Josephine Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult in high remote terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may drop to around 2000 ft elevation or lower briefly at times, possibly affecting the Illinois valley and passes on I-5 between Grants Pass and Roseburg. This will become more likely late Monday morning into the afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent, and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
